issue.title: Added `--namespaces` flag to `glooctl check`

labels.name: keep pr updated
labels.description: signals bulldozer to keep pr up to date with base branch

issue.body:
# Description

Added a —namespaces flag that signals to `glooctl` check pods on a over an array of namespaces.

# Context

The usage is as follows: `glooctl check —namespaces gloo-system,gloo-portal,foo,bar`. This flag reuses the functionality of the -n flag and iterates until failing. This flag also does not de-duplicate.

issue.body:
# Description

UX improvements to our makefile.

# Context

Some of our make targets are not intended for developer use and are only used by the build system/CI, only make targets intended for developer use should have comments.

Fix for issue introduced in https://github.com/solo-io/gloo/pull/7312 which breaks build-test-assets make target: Instead of fixing this bug we removed build-test-assets due to it not being used anywhere and replicable by running make build-test-chart glooctl.

The changes can be proven safe by running them manually.

issue.title: Buildx in OSS
issue.body:
# Description

Docker now uses buildx to build images.

issue.title: Exclude Helm hooks Jobs from Linkerd sidecar injection
issue.body:
Signed-off-by: Alexander Berger <alex-berger@gmx.ch>

# Description

Similar to what is already in place to prevent Istio sidecar injection for Helm hook Jobs, we now also prevent
Linkerd2 side car injection, by adding the corresponding Pod label linkerd.io/inject: "disabled".

This fixes https://github.com/solo-io/gloo/issues/2665

# Description

UX improvements to our makefile and changing of the build tool to buildx.

# Context

Some of our make targets are not intended for developer use and are only used by the build system/CI, only make targets intended for developer use should have comments.

Fix for issue introduced in https://github.com/solo-io/gloo/pull/7312 which breaks build-test-assets make target: Instead of fixing this bug we removed build-test-assets due to it not being used anywhere and replicable by running `make build-test-chart glooctl`.

The changes can be proven safe by running them manually.

Many of the arch specific issues encountered in enterprise were fixed by using the buildx plugin which has support for multi-platform builds. This is a safe change since we don't modify any existing `docker build` behavior.

Can't build the race image. Also building race image on `arm64` machines takes 10 minutes to build on M1 machines, so opt out to build it by default on M1 machines.

labels.description: signals bulldozer to keep pr open (don't auto-merge)

labels.name: keep pr updated
labels.description: signals bulldozer to keep pr up to date with base branch

issue.body:
# Work In Progress
This PR is an accumulated set of changes that will be backported. We can remove the label once we have each of the changes merged into this branch.

# Description

A set of recent fixes that are being backported into 1.12

# Explicitly disable leader election
Signed off by:
- [x] @jenshu 
- [x] @elcasteel 

Backport of: https://github.com/solo-io/gloo/pull/7351

Leader Election does not need to execute when only running a single replica of Gloo. We've noticed that there are certain Edge cases where leader election stops functioning properly (ApiServer throttling or network issues, node failure).

As a short-term solution, we want to make it possible so that users who are not yet trying to receiving the benefits of an HA control-plane, can disable the functionality altogether.

## Testing
### Helm e2e Testing
To confirm that the helm setting actually behaves the way we would expect in a cluster, you can follow:

1. Build the images locally, and load them into a kind cluster: 
```
CLUSTER_NAME=edge VERSION=0.0.0-edge CLUSTER_NODE_VERSION=v1.22.4  ./ci/deploy-to-kind-cluster.sh
```

2. Perform a helm install without this new value
```
helm install gloo _test/gloo-0.0.1-fork.tgz -n gloo-system --create-namespace
```

3. Observe the logs indicate the leader election is taking place
```
 kubectl logs deploy/gloo -n gloo-system -f
...

{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.888Z","caller":"probes/healthz.go:23","msg":"healthz server starting at :8765"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.888Z","caller":"stats/stats.go:96","msg":"Stats server starting at :9091"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.897Z","logger":"gloo.v1.event_loop","caller":"v1/setup_event_loop.sk.go:79","msg":"event loop started","version":"0.0.1-fork"}
I1021 17:40:49.897247       1 leaderelection.go:248] attempting to acquire leader lease gloo-system/gloo...
I1021 17:40:49.907310       1 leaderelection.go:258] successfully acquired lease gloo-system/gloo
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.907Z","caller":"setup/setup.go:43","msg":"new leader elected with ID: gloo-bcdb49599-4m8pq_44e241b4-c475-4c33-b754-2190f859b9c3"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.907Z","logger":"gloo","caller":"setup/setup.go:40","msg":"starting leadership","version":"0.0.1-fork"}
```

4. Uninstall gloo edge
```
helm uninstall gloo -n gloo-system
```

5. Perform a helm install WITH the new value
```
helm install gloo _test/gloo-0.0.1-fork.tgz -n gloo-system --set gloo.disableLeaderElection=true
```

6. Observe the logs indicate that leader election IS NOT taking place
```
 kubectl logs deploy/gloo -n gloo-system -f
 ...
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:42:36.735Z","caller":"probes/healthz.go:23","msg":"healthz server starting at :8765"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:42:36.735Z","caller":"stats/stats.go:96","msg":"Stats server starting at :9091"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:42:36.746Z","logger":"gloo.v1.event_loop","caller":"v1/setup_event_loop.sk.go:79","msg":"event loop started","version":"0.0.1-fork"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:42:37.124Z","logger":"gloo.v1.event_loop.setup.v1.event_loop","caller":"v1/eds_event_loop.sk.go:79","msg":"event loop started","version":"0.0.1-fork"}
```

# Deflake e2e tests
Signed off by:
- [x] @bewebi 
- [x] @gunnar-solo 

Backport of PRs to resolve some recent flakes that affected our `zipkin` and `gzip` and `gateway` tests.

## Testing
Tests were updated in the main PR, and they ran through CI many times to validate the changes.

We do not expect there to be differences with 1.12.

# Checklist:

- [ ] I included a concise, user-facing changelog (for details, see https://github.com/solo-io/go-utils/tree/master/changelogutils) which references the issue that is resolved.
- [ ] If I updated APIs (our protos) or helm values, I ran `make -B install-go-tools generated-code` to ensure there will be no code diff
- [ ] I followed guidelines laid out in the Gloo Edge [contribution guide](https://docs.solo.io/gloo-edge/latest/contributing/)
- [ ] I opened a draft PR or added the work in progress label if my PR is not ready for review
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works

issue.title: Fix: wrapAsApiGatway crashes Envoy on headers-only request
issue.body:
# Description

- Resolves a bug which caused envoy to crash when a headers-only request was sent to an AWS Lambda upstream with `wrapAsApiGateway` enabled.
- This occurred because we previously called `decoder_callbacks_->modifyDecodingBuffer` whenever `wrapAsApiGateway` was enabled
  - Because a decoding buffer does not exist on a headers-only request, attempting to modify a nonexistent decoding buffer caused Envoy to crash
- Now, we transform an empty buffer and then create a decoding buffer from the transformed result using `decoder_callbacks_->addDecodedData` in the case of a headers only request

# Context

- I will put up and link a solo-projects draft PR with e2e tests that validate this fix end-to-end
- That PR will eventually include an envoy-gloo-ee version bump which pulls in the changes contained in this PR

# Description

Can't build the race image. Also building race image on `arm64` machines takes 10 minutes to build on M1 machines, so opt out to build it by default on M1 machines.

Don't need to build the race image every time I need to build Gloo. Only needs to be built during CI builds.

issue.body:
# Work In Progress
This PR is an accumulated set of changes that will be backported. We can remove the label once we have each of the changes merged into this branch.

# Description

A set of recent fixes that are being backported into 1.12

# Explicitly disable leader election
Signed off by:
- [x] @jenshu 
- [x] @elcasteel 

Backport of: https://github.com/solo-io/gloo/pull/7351

Leader Election does not need to execute when only running a single replica of Gloo. We've noticed that there are certain Edge cases where leader election stops functioning properly (ApiServer throttling or network issues, node failure).

As a short-term solution, we want to make it possible so that users who are not yet trying to receiving the benefits of an HA control-plane, can disable the functionality altogether.

## Testing
### Helm e2e Testing
To confirm that the helm setting actually behaves the way we would expect in a cluster, you can follow:

1. Build the images locally, and load them into a kind cluster: 
```
CLUSTER_NAME=edge VERSION=0.0.0-edge CLUSTER_NODE_VERSION=v1.22.4  ./ci/deploy-to-kind-cluster.sh
```

2. Perform a helm install without this new value
```
helm install gloo _test/gloo-0.0.1-fork.tgz -n gloo-system --create-namespace
```

3. Observe the logs indicate the leader election is taking place
```
 kubectl logs deploy/gloo -n gloo-system -f
...

{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.888Z","caller":"probes/healthz.go:23","msg":"healthz server starting at :8765"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.888Z","caller":"stats/stats.go:96","msg":"Stats server starting at :9091"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.897Z","logger":"gloo.v1.event_loop","caller":"v1/setup_event_loop.sk.go:79","msg":"event loop started","version":"0.0.1-fork"}
I1021 17:40:49.897247       1 leaderelection.go:248] attempting to acquire leader lease gloo-system/gloo...
I1021 17:40:49.907310       1 leaderelection.go:258] successfully acquired lease gloo-system/gloo
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.907Z","caller":"setup/setup.go:43","msg":"new leader elected with ID: gloo-bcdb49599-4m8pq_44e241b4-c475-4c33-b754-2190f859b9c3"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.907Z","logger":"gloo","caller":"setup/setup.go:40","msg":"starting leadership","version":"0.0.1-fork"}
```

4. Uninstall gloo edge
```
helm uninstall gloo -n gloo-system
```

5. Perform a helm install WITH the new value
```
helm install gloo _test/gloo-0.0.1-fork.tgz -n gloo-system --set gloo.disableLeaderElection=true
```

6. Observe the logs indicate that leader election IS NOT taking place
```
 kubectl logs deploy/gloo -n gloo-system -f
 ...
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:42:36.735Z","caller":"probes/healthz.go:23","msg":"healthz server starting at :8765"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:42:36.735Z","caller":"stats/stats.go:96","msg":"Stats server starting at :9091"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:42:36.746Z","logger":"gloo.v1.event_loop","caller":"v1/setup_event_loop.sk.go:79","msg":"event loop started","version":"0.0.1-fork"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:42:37.124Z","logger":"gloo.v1.event_loop.setup.v1.event_loop","caller":"v1/eds_event_loop.sk.go:79","msg":"event loop started","version":"0.0.1-fork"}
```

# Deflake e2e tests
Signed off by:
- [x] @bewebi 
- [x] @gunnar-solo 

Backport of PRs to resolve some recent flakes that affected our `zipkin` and `gzip` and `gateway` tests.

## Testing
Tests were updated in the main PR, and they ran through CI many times to validate the changes.

We do not expect there to be differences with 1.12.

# Checklist:

- [ ] I included a concise, user-facing changelog (for details, see https://github.com/solo-io/go-utils/tree/master/changelogutils) which references the issue that is resolved.
- [ ] If I updated APIs (our protos) or helm values, I ran `make -B install-go-tools generated-code` to ensure there will be no code diff
- [ ] I followed guidelines laid out in the Gloo Edge [contribution guide](https://docs.solo.io/gloo-edge/latest/contributing/)
- [ ] I opened a draft PR or added the work in progress label if my PR is not ready for review
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works

issue.title: Fix: wrapAsApiGatway crashes Envoy on headers-only request
issue.body:
# Description

- Resolves a bug which caused envoy to crash when a headers-only request was sent to an AWS Lambda upstream with `wrapAsApiGateway` enabled.
- This occurred because we previously called `decoder_callbacks_->modifyDecodingBuffer` whenever `wrapAsApiGateway` was enabled
  - Because a decoding buffer does not exist on a headers-only request, attempting to modify a nonexistent decoding buffer caused Envoy to crash
- Now, we transform an empty buffer and then create a decoding buffer from the transformed result using `decoder_callbacks_->addDecodedData` in the case of a headers only request

# Context

- I will put up and link a solo-projects draft PR with e2e tests that validate this fix end-to-end
- That PR will eventually include an envoy-gloo-ee version bump which pulls in the changes contained in this PR

issue.title: [1.12] Backport Recent Fixes

labels.name: work in progress
labels.description: signals bulldozer to keep pr open (don't auto-merge)

labels.name: keep pr updated
labels.description: signals bulldozer to keep pr up to date with base branch

issue.body:
# Work In Progress
This PR is an accumulated set of changes that will be backported. We can remove the label once we have each of the changes merged into this branch.

# Description

A set of recent fixes that are being backported into 1.12

# Explicitly disable leader election
Signed off by:
- [x] @jenshu 
- [x] @elcasteel 

Backport of: https://github.com/solo-io/gloo/pull/7351

Leader Election does not need to execute when only running a single replica of Gloo. We've noticed that there are certain Edge cases where leader election stops functioning properly (ApiServer throttling or network issues, node failure).

As a short-term solution, we want to make it possible so that users who are not yet trying to receiving the benefits of an HA control-plane, can disable the functionality altogether.

## Testing
### Helm e2e Testing
To confirm that the helm setting actually behaves the way we would expect in a cluster, you can follow:

1. Build the images locally, and load them into a kind cluster: 
```
CLUSTER_NAME=edge VERSION=0.0.0-edge CLUSTER_NODE_VERSION=v1.22.4  ./ci/deploy-to-kind-cluster.sh
```

2. Perform a helm install without this new value
```
helm install gloo _test/gloo-0.0.1-fork.tgz -n gloo-system --create-namespace
```

3. Observe the logs indicate the leader election is taking place
```
 kubectl logs deploy/gloo -n gloo-system -f
...

{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.888Z","caller":"probes/healthz.go:23","msg":"healthz server starting at :8765"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.888Z","caller":"stats/stats.go:96","msg":"Stats server starting at :9091"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.897Z","logger":"gloo.v1.event_loop","caller":"v1/setup_event_loop.sk.go:79","msg":"event loop started","version":"0.0.1-fork"}
I1021 17:40:49.897247       1 leaderelection.go:248] attempting to acquire leader lease gloo-system/gloo...
I1021 17:40:49.907310       1 leaderelection.go:258] successfully acquired lease gloo-system/gloo
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.907Z","caller":"setup/setup.go:43","msg":"new leader elected with ID: gloo-bcdb49599-4m8pq_44e241b4-c475-4c33-b754-2190f859b9c3"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.907Z","logger":"gloo","caller":"setup/setup.go:40","msg":"starting leadership","version":"0.0.1-fork"}
```

4. Uninstall gloo edge
```
helm uninstall gloo -n gloo-system
```

5. Perform a helm install WITH the new value
```
helm install gloo _test/gloo-0.0.1-fork.tgz -n gloo-system --set gloo.disableLeaderElection=true
```

6. Observe the logs indicate that leader election IS NOT taking place
```
 kubectl logs deploy/gloo -n gloo-system -f
 ...
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:42:36.735Z","caller":"probes/healthz.go:23","msg":"healthz server starting at :8765"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:42:36.735Z","caller":"stats/stats.go:96","msg":"Stats server starting at :9091"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:42:36.746Z","logger":"gloo.v1.event_loop","caller":"v1/setup_event_loop.sk.go:79","msg":"event loop started","version":"0.0.1-fork"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:42:37.124Z","logger":"gloo.v1.event_loop.setup.v1.event_loop","caller":"v1/eds_event_loop.sk.go:79","msg":"event loop started","version":"0.0.1-fork"}
```

# Deflake e2e tests
Signed off by:
- [x] @bewebi 
- [x] @gunnar-solo 

Backport of PRs to resolve some recent flakes that affected our `zipkin` and `gzip` and `gateway` tests.

## Testing
Tests were updated in the main PR, and they ran through CI many times to validate the changes.

We do not expect there to be differences with 1.12.

# Checklist:

- [ ] I included a concise, user-facing changelog (for details, see https://github.com/solo-io/go-utils/tree/master/changelogutils) which references the issue that is resolved.
- [ ] If I updated APIs (our protos) or helm values, I ran `make -B install-go-tools generated-code` to ensure there will be no code diff
- [ ] I followed guidelines laid out in the Gloo Edge [contribution guide](https://docs.solo.io/gloo-edge/latest/contributing/)
- [ ] I opened a draft PR or added the work in progress label if my PR is not ready for review
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works

issue.title: Fix: wrapAsApiGatway crashes Envoy on headers-only request
issue.body:
# Description

- Resolves a bug which caused envoy to crash when a headers-only request was sent to an AWS Lambda upstream with `wrapAsApiGateway` enabled.
- This occurred because we previously called `decoder_callbacks_->modifyDecodingBuffer` whenever `wrapAsApiGateway` was enabled
  - Because a decoding buffer does not exist on a headers-only request, attempting to modify a nonexistent decoding buffer caused Envoy to crash
- Now, we transform an empty buffer and then create a decoding buffer from the transformed result using `decoder_callbacks_->addDecodedData` in the case of a headers only request

# Context

- I will put up and link a solo-projects draft PR with e2e tests that validate this fix end-to-end
- That PR will eventually include an envoy-gloo-ee version bump which pulls in the changes contained in this PR
